author: jayu
name: Vintage Story Code Mod
description: A project for creating a Vintage Story mod.

SuppressWindowsConsoleWindow.description: Suppresses the external console window on Windows. (You may only use this on Windows OS.)

QuickStartCode.description: Includes a ModSystem template to get you started quickly.

AddSampleCode.description: Includes some sample code to get you started.

AddAssetFolder.description: Adds the asset folder to the template mod.

AddSolutionFile.description: Adds .sln file for the mod including both Projects Mod and Cake build system.

AddChangelogFile.description: Adds a sample changelog file to the template mod.

IncludeVSSurvivalMod.description: Adds VSSurvivalMod as reference to the project.

IncludeVSEssentials.description: Adds VSEssentials as reference to the project.

IncludeVSCreativeMod.description: Adds VSCreativeMod as reference to the project.

IncludeNewtonsoft.description: Adds Newtonsoft.Json as reference to the project.

IncludeHarmony.description: Adds Harmony as reference to the project.

IncludeVintagestoryLib.description: Adds VintagestoryLib as reference to the project.

IncludeProtobuf.description: Adds Protobuf-net as reference to the project.

IncludeCairoSharp.description: Adds cairo-sharp as reference to the project.

IncludeSQLite.description: Adds Microsoft.Data.Sqlite as reference to the project.

VSCodeTasks.description: Include VSCode tasks.json and launch.json for testing.

ArmMacOsLaunchSettings.description: (Rider) Include launch settings for Arm Mac OS (You may only need this on Mac OS, maybe linux. Useless with scripts disabled).

AddSampleConfig.description: Includes a sample config loader setup.

AddExtraBuildScripts.description: Includes build.sh and build.ps1 scripts for building the mod with CakeBuild (Not needed on Rider).

AdvancedHarmonySetup.description: Include a more advanced Harmony setup with patch categories. Requires IncludeHarmony.

VSInstall.description: The directory of the Vintage Story installation to use for references and Client/Server launcher.

ModAuthors.description: The names of the mod authors, surrounded by quotes, separated by commas.

ModSide.description: The side of the mod, either 'client', 'server', or 'universal'.

choices.description: Client side mod, only runs on the client
Server side mod, only runs on the server
Universal mod, runs on both client and server
